Class IVTBuffer

extends java.lang.Object

Stores IVT data.

Constructor Detail

IVTBuffer

public IVTBuffer(byte[] ivt)
Initializes this IVT buffer object given a byte array containing valid IVT data.

If the given array is null or contains invalid IVT data, subsequent method calls on this IVT buffer object may throw exceptions.

Parameters:
ivt - Byte array containing valid IVT data.

IVTBuffer

public IVTBuffer(int bufferSize)
Initializes this IVT buffer object using a given buffer size.

Parameters:
bufferSize - Size of the buffer in bytes to allocate.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - The detail message of the exception may consist of the following values:
"VIBE_E_INVALID_ARGUMENT"
The size of the buffer is too small.
"VIBE_E_NOT_SUPPORTED"
This function is not supported in the 3000 edition of the API. To get the API edition level, call Device.getCapabilityInt32 with the ImmVibe.VIBE_DEVCAPTYPE_EDITION_LEVEL device capability type.
Method Detail

getBuiltInEffects

public static IVTBuffer getBuiltInEffects()
Retrieves the built-in IVT effect data. The built-in IVT data provides a set of effects that can be played by calling Device.playIVTEffect or Device.playIVTEffectRepeat.

Returns:
Built-in IVT effect data.

getBuffer

public byte[] getBuffer()
Gets the IVT data stored in this IVT buffer.

Returns:
Stored IVT data.

getEffectCount

public int getEffectCount()
Gets the number of effects defined in this IVT buffer.

Returns:
Number of effects defined in this IVT buffer.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - The detail message of the exception may consist of the following values:
"VIBE_E_INVALID_ARGUMENT"
This IVT buffer contains invalid data.
"VIBE_E_FAIL"
Error getting the effect count.

getEffectDuration

public int getEffectDuration(int effectIndex)
Gets the duration of an effect defined in this IVT buffer.

Parameters:
effectIndex - Index of the effect. The effect index must be greater than or equal to zero and less than the number of effects returned by getEffectCount.
Returns:
Duration of the effect.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - The detail message of the exception may consist of the following values:
"VIBE_E_INVALID_ARGUMENT"
One or more of the arguments is invalid; for example,
  • This IVT buffer contains invalid data.
  • The effectIndex parameter is negative, or greater than or equal to the value returned by getEffectCount.
"VIBE_E_FAIL"
Error getting the effect duration.

getEffectIndexFromName

public int getEffectIndexFromName(java.lang.String effectName)
Gets the index of an effect defined in this IVT buffer given the name of the effect.

Parameters:
effectName - Name of the effect for which to get the index.
Returns:
Index of the effect.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - The detail message of the exception may consist of the following values:
"VIBE_E_INVALID_ARGUMENT"
One or more of the arguments is invalid; for example,
  • This IVT buffer contains invalid data.
  • The effectName parameter is invalid.
"VIBE_E_FAIL"
An effect with the given name was not found in the IVT data.

Gets the name of an effect defined in this IVT buffer.

Parameters:

Name of the effect.

  • The effectIndex parameter is negative, or greater than or equal to the value returned by getEffectCount.

getEffectType

public int getEffectType(int effectIndex)
Gets the type of an effect defined in this IVT buffer.

Parameters:
effectIndex - Index of the effect. The effect index must be greater than or equal to zero and less than the number of effects returned by getEffectCount.
Returns:
Type of the effect. The effect type is one of
  • ImmVibe.VIBE_EFFECT_TYPE_MAGSWEEP
  • ImmVibe.VIBE_EFFECT_TYPE_PERIODIC
  • ImmVibe.VIBE_EFFECT_TYPE_WAVEFORM
  • ImmVibe.VIBE_EFFECT_TYPE_TIMELINE
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - The detail message of the exception may consist of the following values:
"VIBE_E_INVALID_ARGUMENT"
One or more of the arguments is invalid; for example,
  • This IVT buffer contains invalid data.
  • The effectIndex parameter is negative, or greater than or equal to the value returned by getEffectCount.
"VIBE_E_FAIL"
Error getting the effect type.

getMagSweepEffectDefinitionAtIndex

public MagSweepEffectDefinition getMagSweepEffectDefinitionAtIndex(int effectIndex)
Gets the definition of a MagSweep effect in this IVT buffer.

Parameters:
effectIndex - Index of the effect. The effect index must be greater than or equal to zero and less than the number of effects returned by getEffectCount.
Returns:
The MagSweep effect definition.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - The detail message of the exception may consist of the following values:
"VIBE_E_INVALID_ARGUMENT"
One or more of the arguments is invalid; for example,
  • This IVT buffer contains invalid data.
  • The effectIndex parameter is negative, or greater than or equal to the value returned by getEffectCount.
"VIBE_E_FAIL"
Error getting the effect parameters.
"VIBE_E_INCOMPATIBLE_EFFECT_TYPE"
The effectIndex parameter does not specify a MagSweep effect.

"VIBE_E_INCOMPATIBLE_EFFECT_TYPE"

getSize

public int getSize()
Gets the size of the IVT data in this buffer.

Call this function to determine the size of the IVT data within this buffer. This function may be called at any time but is normally called before saving an IVT file that was changed by calling insertElement or removeElement.

This function is supported only in the 4000 and 5000 API editions. To get the API edition level, call Device.getCapabilityInt32 with the ImmVibe.VIBE_DEVCAPTYPE_EDITION_LEVEL device capability type.

Returns:
Size of the IVT data in bytes. The size of the IVT data will be less than or equal to the size of this buffer.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - The detail message of the exception may consist of the following values:
"VIBE_E_INVALID_ARGUMENT"
This IVT buffer contains invalid data.
"VIBE_E_NOT_SUPPORTED"
This function is not supported in the 3000 edition of the API. To get the API edition level, call Device.getCapabilityInt32 with the ImmVibe.VIBE_DEVCAPTYPE_EDITION_LEVEL device capability type.

insertElement

public void insertElement(int timelineIndex,
                          IVTElement element)
Inserts an element into a Timeline effect in this IVT buffer. The element will be added in chronological order.

If this IVT buffer does not contain a Timeline effect, pass zero for timelineIndex and a Timeline effect will be created to house the element.

This function is supported only in the 4000 and 5000 API editions. To get the API edition level, call Device.getCapabilityInt32 with the ImmVibe.VIBE_DEVCAPTYPE_EDITION_LEVEL device capability type.

Parameters:
timelineIndex - Index of a Timeline effect in which to insert the element. If the IVT data only contains one Timeline effect, pass zero for this parameter. If the IVT data does not contain a Timeline effect, pass zero for this parameter and the API will create a Timeline effect to house this element.
element - Parameters of a Periodic effect, MagSweep effect, Waveform effect, or Repeat event to insert into the Timeline effect.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - The detail message of the exception may consist of the following values:
"VIBE_E_INVALID_ARGUMENT"
One or more of the arguments is invalid; for example,
  • This IVT buffer contains invalid data.
  • The timelineIndex parameter is not a valid index of a Timeline effect.
"VIBE_E_FAIL"
Error inserting the element.
"VIBE_E_NOT_SUPPORTED"
This function is not supported in the 3000 edition of the API. To get the API edition level, call Device.getCapabilityInt32 with the ImmVibe.VIBE_DEVCAPTYPE_EDITION_LEVEL device capability type.

removeElement

public void removeElement(int timelineIndex,
                          int elementIndex)
Removes the element at the specified index from a Timeline effect in this IVT buffer.

If the simple effect referenced by this element is not referenced by any other element, the simple effect will also be removed. A simple effect is a MagSweep, Periodic, or Waveform effect.

If the element being removed is the only element in a Timeline effect, the Timeline effect will also be removed.

Start-times of subsequent elements will not be modified.

This function is supported only in the 4000 and 5000 API editions. To get the API edition level, call Device.getCapabilityInt32 with the ImmVibe.VIBE_DEVCAPTYPE_EDITION_LEVEL device capability type.

Parameters:
timelineIndex - Index of a Timeline effect from which to remove the element. If the IVT data only contains one Timeline effect, pass zero for this parameter.
elementIndex - Index of the element to remove.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - The detail message of the exception may consist of the following values:
"VIBE_E_INVALID_ARGUMENT"
One or more of the arguments is invalid; for example,
  • This IVT buffer contains invalid data.
  • The timelineIndex parameter is not a valid index of a Timeline effect.
  • The elementIndex parameter is not a valid index of an element in the Timeline effect.
"VIBE_E_FAIL"
Error removing the element.
"VIBE_E_NOT_SUPPORTED"
This function is not supported in the 3000 edition of the API. To get the API edition level, call Device.getCapabilityInt32 with the ImmVibe.VIBE_DEVCAPTYPE_EDITION_LEVEL device capability type.

readElement

public IVTElement readElement(int timelineIndex,
                              int elementIndex)
Retrieves an element of a Timeline effect in this IVT buffer. The element may be a Periodic effect, or MagSweep effect, a Waveform effect, or a Repeat event.

This function is supported only in the 4000 and 5000 API editions. To get the API edition level, call Device.getCapabilityInt32 with the ImmVibe.VIBE_DEVCAPTYPE_EDITION_LEVEL device capability type.

Parameters:
timelineIndex - Index of a Timeline effect from which to read the element. If the IVT data only contains one Timeline effect, pass zero for this parameter.
elementIndex - Index of the element to retrieve.
Returns:
Retrieved element parameters.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - The detail message of the exception may consist of the following values:
"VIBE_E_INVALID_ARGUMENT"
One or more of the arguments is invalid; for example,
  • This IVT buffer contains invalid data.
  • The timelineIndex parameter is not a valid index of a Timeline effect.
  • The elementIndex parameter is not a valid index of an element in the Timeline effect.
"VIBE_E_FAIL"
Error reading the element.
"VIBE_E_NOT_SUPPORTED"
This function is not supported in the 3000 edition of the API. To get the API edition level, call Device.getCapabilityInt32 with the ImmVibe.VIBE_DEVCAPTYPE_EDITION_LEVEL device capability type.

saveHapticTrack

public void saveHapticTrack(java.lang.String pathName)
Saves an IVT file to persistent storage.

Parameters:
pathName - Path name of the file to save.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - The detail message of the exception may consist of the following values:
"VIBE_E_INVALID_ARGUMENT"
One or more of the arguments is invalid; for example,
  • This IVT buffer contains invalid data.
  • The pathName parameter is invalid.
"VIBE_E_FAIL"
Error saving the IVT file.
"VIBE_E_NOT_ENOUGH_MEMORY"
The API cannot allocation memory to complete the request. This happens when the device runs low in memory.
"VIBE_E_SERVICE_BUSY"
The Player Service is busy and could not complete the request.
"VIBE_E_NOT_SUPPORTED"
This method is not supported in the present implementation.

deleteHapticTrack

public static void deleteHapticTrack(java.lang.String pathName)
Removes an IVT file from persistent storage.

Parameters:
pathName - Path name of the file to remove.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - The detail message of the exception may consist of the following values:
"VIBE_E_INVALID_ARGUMENT"
The pathName parameter is invalid.
"VIBE_E_FAIL"
Error removing the IVT file.
"VIBE_E_SERVICE_BUSY"
The Player Service is busy and could not complete the request.
"VIBE_E_NOT_SUPPORTED"
This method is not supported in the present implementation.
